newsitem.title: EGYPT: Arafat leaves for United States.
newsitem.headline: Arafat leaves for United States.

text.p: Palestinian President Yasser Arafat left for the United States on Sunday after a day of talks in Cairo on Israel's decision to build a new Jewish settlement in East Jerusalem.
Arafat told the Cairo-based Arab League on Saturday the Israeli plan was an attempt to destroy the peace process. Peace with settlements was impossible, he said.
Arafat suggested he might retaliate by declaring a Palestinian state, a gesture likely to anger rightwing Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

"We are supposed to declare the setting up of a Palestinian state in five years but what would happen if I declare it right here? What would he (Netanyahu) do then? It's tit-for-tat and we have our weapons too," Arafat said.
The Palestinian leader is expected to air his grievances when he meets U.S. President Bill Clinton on Monday.
